ratings.comment: Very knowledgable and nice! Sometimes he would ramble or the lectures would be dense, but overall a great teacher.
dasofnaisjdfas
Very caring and passionate about his work

This class was unnecessarily difficult. Pan is super kind hearted and truly cares for his students, but grading is unclear, lectures are confusing, and discussion sections are more confusing than anything else. I enjoyed Pan as a person, but his material was far more complex than it needed to be. 5 quizzes, 3 precis, 2 dis boards, 1 final essay.

I enjoyed Pan's lectures. He's a really sweet and funny guy. His class was not structured well though. The discussion sessions were boring and felt like bad lectures. Grading criteria isn't clear and every assignment outside of quizzes is boring and useless. I'd take the prof again but not the TA or the class. Least favorite class this semester.
Prof. Pan is very knowledgeable and considerate of students! He is helpful in delivering domain knowledge and very generous in grading and helping us out. I really enjoy taking CA325

Zhongdang is very knowledgable on the material he teaches in class, but it can sometimes be hard to understand him due to language barriers. He is so sweet, and an adorable man. I wouldn't rate him a 5 simply because he gives a lot of information in lecture - almost too much, but an amazing man of course!

This was my second time taking a class with Pan and it was extremely difficult. The quiz questions are confusing and he is a super tough grader. Nice guy and was always glad to help at office hours but this class still gave me an unnecessary amount of stress. I would pick another CA elective

I found this class to be extremely challenging. The lectures materials that Prof. Pan were all just summaries of previous studies. I wish he could have just taught us the concepts. I love psychology, but I did not love this class.
Pan is a nice guy however the TA's are awful. Grading was extremely brutal and there were a lot of big assignments and two tough exams. Doable and somewhat interesting but there is A LOT of content.

I don't think this class is hard but it is a lot of reading on studies that are confusing. The lecture slides are very broad, and I really have no idea what's going on or being taught. I don't feel like the topics are throroughly discussed. Discussion sections don't really help this issue either. I don't think the tests are hard.

He was enthusiastic and knowledgeable in what he taught. Clear concepts in lectures regularly - the tests and exam would become so much easier. I also like the TA (Mr. Julian Mueller-Herbst) who was the best TA I've ever met. He was always very patient to students and treated them fairly. He taught me in Fall and I still remember how nice he was.

He is extremely passionate about the subject, yet there are a lot of papers to read and write. However, the TA grades them rather harshly so if there is a site called ratemyTAs I would give him a 3 maximum. Pan as a professor is fantastic, he provides midterm and final review slides and up to 3% extra credit which make our lives much easier.

Professor Pan is really knowledgeable about the topic but the lectures are primarily focused on research. The lectures are accessible outside of class and are really detailed, which is very useful while preparing for exams. You have to go over every research in order to do well in exams. There are several papers and a final group project.

Professor is really knowledgeable about the topic but the lectures are primarily focused on research. The lectures are accessible outside of class and are really detailed, which is very useful while preparing for exams. You have to go over every research in order to do well in exams. There are several papers and a final group project.

Pan is a great professor.  Class is optional, but participation is part of your grade; however, he uses an app called TopHat that you use to participate, and you can use the app and participate from the comfort of your bed.  Grade is based on three 2 page papers, a 6-8 page paper, an 8 page group paper, and two 40 question multiple choice tests.

Pan is probably up there with one of the worst professors I've had. Not only is his lecture material scattered and confusing, I physically don't understand the words coming out of his mouth. His accent is hard to work with and that makes lectures painful. Exams are rough and each question is a paragraph, along with the answers. Would NOT recommend.

Pan is a great researcher for the University of Wisconsin, but if you take a class with him and expect him to explain concepts in a way that students can understand, good luck.  His slides are confusing and pointless to review, and he cannot explain any of his theories well enough for the class to understand.

Pan is an extremely nice and funny guy. However, it is very hard to follow his lectures and slides. There is something about his speaking style which makes it very hard to follow and pay attention in class. The exams are quite hard

Pan is hilarious! He is really interested in what he is teaching, and it really shows. I found most of the lectures really interesting, although his powerpoints were sometimes a bit scrambled and confusing to follow. Overall, great professor

Great professor, somewhat common sense material.  Lectures can be boring at times but is necessary to do really well on the exam.  He posts all lectures as powerpoints on Learn@UW and has a study guide for each exam.  Really laid back and the material is easy to comprehend.  Go to discussion!
He taught me in 1997 and things I've learned from him--passion, integrity, discipline, humor, hardworking, caring for students--are now gradually part of me. The most inspiring professor in my life.

I had Pan for 325 as well and he remembered me 2 years later in 525.  He is incredibly smart, understanding, loves what he does, entertaining, and probably one of the best profs I had the opportunity to work with at UW.  Classes aren't that hard if you do the work and he is more than willing to help.

Pan is hilarious. Make sure you take his discussion section. The class really isn't as hard as everyone says. There are two exams and four papers that are all very easy. I attended lecture a total of four times and I got an A. Read the book no matter what because the few lectures I went to were very confusing! The book clarified everything.

Pan is a great teacher and a funny guy. However DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! The tests are IMPOSSIBLE! his study guide was 15 pages long and impossible to study for. Papers are easy, but information all over the place. very disorganized and lots of facts and information thrown at you

he is so good at what he does. I feel like it's not hard to do well if you go to class, listen, skim through readings. There's no excuse to do badly seeing as the papers have detailed instrucations and he posts ALL his materials online. Very organized and clear prof.super funny too.

He is a very intelligent and silly man. He's also very well organized. The problem comes in the fact that there is so muich to read. The content is overwhelming so you don't really grasp what matters. Also, ever paper (there are three) comes with a page long description, which ironically makes it hard to understand what he wants exactly.
Pan's a smart guy, but the content is so boring. Worst class I've ever taken.
LOVE pan. probably the cutest, funniest professor ever; he's very interested in what he's teaching which helps me stay sort of interested. always available to help and overall just a great professor.
very hard tests and papers require tons of research that have to each be over 15 pages long... lectures are interesting but could be condensed... dont recomend

I LOVE PAN! He's a funny and charismatic professor who gives really good real-life examples to tie in the materials. Has a bizarre fixation on Catherine Zeta-Jones. Chain smokes before and after lecture. A fair and honest grader.

Good professor.  Very enthusiastic about the subject (some of the experiments presented in class are his own).  Subject material can get a little boring but he presents it clearly and energetically which helps.
